title: Man arrested in connection with shooting involving two children on Cleveland's West Side
content:
(Brandon Blackwell, Northeast Ohio Media Group)
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- A man has been arrested in connection with the shooting investigation of two siblings on Cleveland's West Side.
Cleveland Police Lt. Ali Pillow said that the 30-year-old man, described as the siblings' uncle, was not specifically arrested for shooting the children. Pillow said more information will become available when charges are filed.
The shooting occurred on Willowdale Avenue across from Riverside Cemetery on the city's West Side early Saturday. Two children, a nine-year-old girl and a two-year-old boy, were both shot in the torso.
They were taken to MetroHealth Medical Center in critical condition. The children remain in critical condition as of about 6:30 p.m. Saturday.
The gun has not been recovered.
Another man, the father of at least one of the children shot at the residence, was arrested at the home Saturday afternoon on unrelated warrants. In total, five children and four adults inside the home at the time of the shooting.
In an unrelated shooting, another Cleveland child was shot Friday night. A seven-year-old East Side boy was shot in the hand while playing on his street. Pillow did not have any updates on the child's status Saturday evening.
